hanzi-su-wiki:
滞

Значения

Задерживаться, застревать

Мнемоника

Водяной 氵 пояс 帯, разлив воды на дороге, затор.

Варианты

滯
purpleculture_pinyin:
zhì
sluggish
вялый
rtega_mnemonic:
滯滯RS
滞滞		block up, obstruct, stagnant
  • belt 帶/带 blocking the flow of fluid 氵 in the arm
purpleculture_info:
(Trad.: 滯)
Pictophonetic: 带 indicates the sound; 氵 (water) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
滞后 [ zhì hòu ]: to lag behind
停滞 [ tíng zhì ]: stagnation; at a standstill; bogged down
滞留 [ zhì liú ]: to detain; retention
呆滞 [ dāi zhì ]: dull; lifeless; sluggish
滞销 [ zhì xiāo ]: to sell poorly; unmarketable; slow-moving (product, inventory etc)
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 氵 [ shuǐ ] water
    • 带 [ dài ] belt, strap; band, ribbon; area, zone; to carry, to raise, to wear
heisig_chinese_memo: History of the first karate blackbelts: In those days, it was often difficult to find fresh, clean water, so samurai usually had to wash their sashes in stagnant puddles. The longer one had been studying martial arts, the older the sash on one's karate uniform and, therefore, the darker the color. So why weren't their karate uniforms black too? Never seen a ninja????
heisig_constituent: stagnate, water, water droplets, water pistol, sash, buckle, apron, crown, towel
heisig_story: People that have been "sashed" to something (whether their mother's apron strings or a particular job) for too long become like water that has stopped moving: they start to stagnate.
koohiiStory1: History of the first karate blackbelts: In those days, it was often difficult to find fresh, clean water, so samurai usually had to wash their sashes in stagnant puddles. The longer one had been studying martial arts, the older the sash on one´s karate uniform and, therefore, the darker the color. So why weren´t their karate uniforms black too? Never seen a ninja????
koohiiStory2: A moat is a stagnate ring of water like an obi (sash) of water tied around the castle.
jp_example_words:
滞納(たいのう): non-payment, default
停滞(ていたい): stagnation, tie-up, congestion, retention, accumulation, falling into arrears
滞る(とどこおる): to stagnate, to be delayed
渋滞(じゅうたい): congestion (e.g. traffic), delay, stagnation
滞在(たいざい): stay, sojourn
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: A tsunami, once stopped by a belt, will begin to stagnate. This belt is a belt of water resistance, so the belt stops the tsunami. The belt has caused the tsunami to stagnate.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Watch this belt as it stagnated the tsunami. See the belt glow as its enchantment activates, immediately stagnating the tsunami water.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: While you watch the tsunami stagnate, you get ready for work. While you were watching this whole thing happening, you were tying your tie (たい). Once the tsunami stagnated, you were all done tying your tie. And since the tsunami is no longer a threat, you’re ready to go to work.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Look in the mirror at you in your tie. Put the finishing touches on your outfit and imagine going out into the world with your tie on, no longer afraid of any tsunamis. They’re all stagnant now thanks to that magical belt.
Ru_trainchinese: zhì: (графема) застойный, застарелый, скопившийся, нагромождённый
Kanshudo_mnemonic: if you cross a belt (帯) of water (氵), you'll probably have to stay over
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: History of the first karate blackbelts: In those days, it was often difficult to find fresh, clean water, so samurai usually had to wash their sashes in stagnant (stagnate) puddles. The longer one had been studying martial arts, the older the sash on one's karate uniform and, therefore, the darker the color. So why weren't their karate uniforms black too? Never seen a ninja????

滞字的基本解释

滞
（滯）
zhì
凝积，不流通，不灵活：停滞。滞留。滞销。滞空。呆滞。滞产（产妇临产后总产程超过30小时者）。滞针。滞下（痢疾的古称）。
遗落：“此有滞穗”。
畅

滞字的汉语字典释义

[①]［zhì］
［《廣韻》直例切，去祭，澄。］
“滞1”的繁体字。亦作“蹛2”。
(1)积聚；凝结；积压。
(2)指积压的事物。
(3)静止；停止。
(4)逗留；耽搁。
(5)久，长期。
(6)局限；拘泥；固执。
(7)迟缓；迟钝。
(8)滞涩，阻碍，不流畅。
(9)指不舒展。
(10)疑难，不易通晓。
(11)指扞格不通。
(12)遗落，遗漏。
(13)废，废置不用。
(14)指废置不用的人。
[②]［chì］
［《集韻》丑例切，去祭，徹。］
“滞2”的繁体字。
见“滯2沛”。

滞字的英文翻译

◎ 滞
sluggish, stagnant

滞字的康熙字典解释

【巳集上】【水字部】　滯； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页643第24
【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?直例切，音彘。【說文】凝也。【周語】震雷出滯。　又積也。【魯語】敢告滯積，以紓執事。　又漏也。【詩·小雅】此有滯穗。　又【周禮·地官·廛人】凡珍異之有滯者，斂而入于膳府。【疏】謂沈滯不售者。　又【左傳·成十八年】晉悼公命百官振廢滯。　又【集韻】尺制切，音摯。音敗不和也。或作懘。亦作慸?。　又丑例切，音跇。水灑散貌。　又【韻補】叶直帶切，音與?近。【楚辭·九章】乗舲船余上沅兮，齊吳榜以擊汰。船容與而不進兮，淹回水以凝滯。

滞字的源字形

滞字的起名意思

暂无。

Stagnant
Basic explanation of words
Stagnant
(Stay)
zhì
Condensation, no circulation, inflexibility: stagnation. Stranded. unsalable. Stagnant. sluggish. Delayed labor (who has a total labor of more than 30 hours after delivery). Stuck needle. Stagnation (an ancient name for dysentery).
Lost: "There are stagnant ears here."
smooth
Stagnant
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［zhì］
["Guangyun" cut straight, go to sacrifice, clear. ]
Traditional characters for "lag 1". Also known as "蹛2".
(1) Accumulation; condensation; backlog.
(2) Refers to the backlog of things.
(3) Stand still; stop.
(4) Stay; delay.
(5) Long, long-term.
(6) Limitations; obsessiveness; stubbornness.
(7) Slow; slow.
(8) Stagnation, obstruction, and turbulence.
(9) Refers to not stretching.
(10) Difficulties, not easy to understand.
(11) Refers to the unreasonable meaning.
(12) Missing, omission.
(13) Abolish, discard and disuse.
(14) Refers to a person who is abandoned.
[②]［chì］
["Jiyun" ugly case cut, go to sacrifice, thorough. ]
Traditional Chinese characters for "lag 2".
See "Stagnation 2 Pei".

Stagnant
Source glyph
Stagnant
Name meaning
Nothing.
会意字。从水(?),篆书形体像一道水流,表示水不流通为滞;从帶(带),带是東腰之物,有捆束一义,表示水受阻不
流动为滞。滯简化为滞。本义是水凝滯。泛指不流通。
积留;不流通:~留|~销「停~。
~得 ~洪 ~货 ~泥~涩~胀 板~ 沉~
迟~ 呆~ 凝~ 气~ 淤~ 阻~ 停~不前
滞
zhì
滞。
滞
Зная слово.
От воды (?) Сценарий печати похож на поток воды, что означает, что вода не циркулирует как застой; от пояса (пояса) пояс представляет собой что-то вроде восточной талии, что имеет значение связывания, что означает что вода заблокирована и не течет как застой.
Гистерезис упрощен до гистерезиса.
Первоначальное значение - застой воды.
Относится к изъятию из обращения.
Накапливать; не распространять: ~ оставаться | ~ продано "стоп ~".
~ Получил ~ хон ~ товары ~ грязь ~ вяжущее ~ вспененный картон ~ раковина ~
Позднее ~ пребывание ~ конденсация ~ газ ~ ил ~ сопротивление ~ останов ~ не вперед
Застойный
Застойный.
Застойный
zhì
I
гл. А
1) останавливаться, задерживаться, оставаться (на одном месте); быть в неподвижности, не двигаться; неподвижный
滞穗 оставшиеся несобранными колосья
流而不滞 течёт и не останавливается на месте
圣人不凝滞于物 совершенный мудрец не привержен к вещам
2) застаиваться; залёживаться; скопляться; сгущаться, застывать; застойный; скопившийся, нагромождённый
滞疾 застарелый недуг
滞水 стоячая вода
滞惑 накопившиеся сомнения
гл. Б
накапливать, копить
滞财 накапливать ценности, копить богатство
II сущ.
* вм. 蛰 (насекомое в спячке)
Radicals: 帯, 氵  (belt, tsunami)
Meaning Mnemonic
A tsunami, once stopped by a belt, will begin to stagnate. This belt is a belt of water resistance, so the belt stops the tsunami. The belt has caused the tsunami to stagnate.
Watch this belt as it stagnated the tsunami. See the belt glow as its enchantment activates, immediately stagnating the tsunami water.
Reading Mnemonic
While you watch the tsunami stagnate, you get ready for work. While you were watching this whole thing happening, you were tying your tie (たい). Once the tsunami stagnated, you were all done tying your tie. And since the tsunami is no longer a threat, you’re ready to go to work.
Look in the mirror at you in your tie. Put the finishing touches on your outfit and imagine going out into the world with your tie on, no longer afraid of any tsunamis. They’re all stagnant now thanks to that magical belt.
